meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irritating or annoying.
meanings.sent1: The constant irritancy of the buzzing mosquito kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: Her habit of tapping her pen on the desk was a constant irritancy to her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The irritancy of the squeaky door was so persistent that it almost seemed intentional.
meanings.sent4: The irritancy of the dripping faucet echoed through the empty house like a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The irritancy of the scratchy fabric against his skin made him squirm uncomfortably.

meanings.definition: A source of irritation or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The loud neighbors were a major irritancy in the otherwise peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The slow internet connection was a constant irritancy for the remote workers.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog next door became an irritancy that disrupted the entire street.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was an irritancy that tested everyone's patience.
meanings.sent5: The persistent telemarketing calls were an irritancy that drove her to disconnect the phone.

meanings.definition: The act of causing irritation or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: His constant interrupting of the teacher's explanations was an irritancy in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive beeping of the alarm clock was an irritancy that woke him up every morning.
meanings.sent3: The irritancy of the dripping faucet was finally fixed after weeks of complaints.
meanings.sent4: The irritancy of the broken elevator forced everyone to take the stairs.
meanings.sent5: The irritancy of the malfunctioning printer caused delays in the office workflow.
